turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sudden Fear.
turn.1: What is known about the film Sudden Fear?
turn.2: Sudden Fear Sudden Fear Is a 1952 American film noir thriller directed by David Miller, and starring Joan Crawford and Jack Palance in a tale about a successful woman who marries a murderous man.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The screenplay by Lenore J. Coffee and Robert Smith was based upon the novel of the same name by Edna Sherry.
turn.5: What was the most interesting aspect of the film?
turn.6: Myra Hudson (Crawford) is a successful Broadway playwright who rejects Lester Blaine (Palance) as the lead in her new play.
turn.8: Later, she meets Lester on a train bound for San Francisco, is swept off her feet, and, after a brief courtship, marries him.
turn.10: Lester learns that Myra is writing her will and plans to leave the bulk of her fortune to a foundation.
turn.11: What does he do when he learns about her foundation?
turn.12: He plots her murder in cahoots with Irene Neves (Gloria Grahame), an old girlfriend hiding in the wings.
